comment: Simplify an implication between two implications when the antecedent of the first is a consequence of the antecedent of the second. The reverse form is useful in producing the successor step in induction proofs. (Contributed by Paul Chapman, 22-Jun-2011.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 14-Sep-2013.)
